title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
IAC is in advanced talks to acquire magazine publisher Meredith, owner of brands including People, InStyle and Better Homes & Gardens, in an effort to build more scale in online publishing.

---

U.S. stocks jumped, with the Dow industrials, S&P 500 and Nasdaq notching gains of 1.5%, 1.2% and 1%, respectively.

---

Chinese authorities are asking local governments to prepare for the potential downfall of Evergrande, officials familiar with the discussions said.

---

The U.S. and European economies slowed in September as supply-chain bottlenecks and worries over the Delta variant weighed on businesses, purchasing managers' surveys showed.

---

Initial jobless claims in the U.S. climbed slightly last week but remained near pandemic lows, as demand for workers keeps a lid on layoffs.

---

A new technology platform backed by the biggest U.S. banks and money managers is aiming to bring the IPO market into the digital age.

---

Disney isn't pursuing an independent inquiry into how the network handled sexual-assault allegations against a former top producer of ABC's "GMA," the show's executive producer told staffers.

---

Amazon is once again embroiled in politically charged controversy as it tries to establish another regional headquarters, this time in Cape Town, South Africa.
